intro: Canthium martini, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruits that encase the seeds. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathium structures, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium martini is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
